rules.natural: If the security analyst detects a malware incident, then the company contains the security breach
Either the security analyst detects a malware incident or escalates the incident to management
Provided that the SIEM system monitors network traffic, then should the company fail to contain the security breach, the forensic team conducts a digital investigation

If the IT department implements backup recovery procedures, then under the condition that breach detection triggering incident response does not lead to legal team notification, the company avoids facing regulatory fines
Either the IT department implements backup recovery procedures or the company engages an external cybersecurity firm
Should the company engage an external cybersecurity firm, then if breach detection triggering incident response does not result in legal team notification, the company does not face regulatory fines
When the incident response team activates containment protocols, they isolate infected systems
When the hacker bypasses security protocols, they access sensitive data
If the hacker bypasses security protocols, then they deploy ransomware
Either the hacker bypasses security protocols or the isolation of infected systems by the incident response team leads to the company containing the security breach
If the hacker deploys ransomware, then they do not access sensitive data
Given that breach detection triggering incident response does not lead to legal team notification, the company faces regulatory fines
If the escalation of the incident to management by the security analyst does not lead to the company containing the security breach, then management ignores the security alert
Provided that the escalation of the incident to management by the security analyst does not result in the company containing the security breach, management does not ignore the security alert
Should the company's failure to contain the security breach not lead to legal team notification of regulatory authorities, then the company settles a class action lawsuit
When the company fails to contain the security breach, breach detection triggers incident response
If the company does not contain the security breach, then the forensic team does not conduct a digital investigation
Should the company fail to contain the security breach, the legal team does not notify regulatory authorities

facts.natural: The SIEM system monitors network traffic
The incident response team activates containment protocols
The company does not settle a class action lawsuit

target.natural: The company contains the security breach

The company contains the security breach
Provided that the company does not contain the security breach, the legal team notifies regulatory authorities
The company contains the security breach
If the company does not contain the security breach, then the forensic team conducts a digital investigation
The company contains the security breach
Under the condition that breach detection triggering incident response does not result in legal team notification, the company does not face regulatory fines
When breach detection triggers incident response, the legal team notifies regulatory authorities
Provided that the company does not contain the security breach, the legal team notifies regulatory authorities
The company contains the security breach

natural_facts.A2: The security analyst escalates the incident to management
natural_facts.A4: The incident response team activates containment protocols
natural_facts.A5: The incident response team isolates infected systems
natural_facts.A9: The legal team notifies regulatory authorities

natural_facts.G: The company contains the security breach

(A1 → G).natural: If the security analyst detects a malware incident, then the company contains the security breach

(A1 ∨ A2).natural: Either the security analyst detects a malware incident or escalates the incident to management

(A12 → (¬G → A11)).natural: Provided that the SIEM system monitors network traffic, then should the company fail to contain the security breach, the forensic team conducts a digital investigation

(A13 → A9).natural: When breach detection triggers incident response, the legal team notifies regulatory authorities

(A15 → (¬(A13 → A9) → ¬A14)).natural: If the IT department implements backup recovery procedures, then under the condition that breach detection triggering incident response does not lead to legal team notification, the company avoids facing regulatory fines

(A15 ∨ A16).natural: Either the IT department implements backup recovery procedures or the company engages an external cybersecurity firm

(A16 → (¬(A13 → A9) → ¬A14)).natural: Should the company engage an external cybersecurity firm, then if breach detection triggering incident response does not result in legal team notification, the company does not face regulatory fines

(A2 → G).natural: If the security analyst escalates the incident to management, then the company contains the security breach

(A4 → A5).natural: When the incident response team activates containment protocols, they isolate infected systems

(A4 → G).natural: Provided that the incident response team activates containment protocols, the company contains the security breach

(A5 → G).natural: If the incident response team isolates infected systems, then the company contains the security breach

(A6 → A7).natural: When the hacker bypasses security protocols, they access sensitive data

(A6 → A8).natural: If the hacker bypasses security protocols, then they deploy ransomware

(A6 → ¬A7).natural: Should the hacker bypass security protocols, they do not access sensitive data

(A6 ∨ (A5 → G)).natural: Either the hacker bypasses security protocols or the isolation of infected systems by the incident response team leads to the company containing the security breach

(A8 → ¬A7).natural: If the hacker deploys ransomware, then they do not access sensitive data

(¬(A13 → A9) → A14).natural: Given that breach detection triggering incident response does not lead to legal team notification, the company faces regulatory fines

(¬(A13 → A9) → ¬A14).natural: Under the condition that breach detection triggering incident response does not result in legal team notification, the company does not face regulatory fines

(¬(A2 → G) → A3).natural: If the escalation of the incident to management by the security analyst does not lead to the company containing the security breach, then management ignores the security alert

(¬(A2 → G) → ¬A3).natural: Provided that the escalation of the incident to management by the security analyst does not result in the company containing the security breach, management does not ignore the security alert

(¬(¬G → A9) → A10).natural: Should the company's failure to contain the security breach not lead to legal team notification of regulatory authorities, then the company settles a class action lawsuit

(¬G → A11).natural: If the company does not contain the security breach, then the forensic team conducts a digital investigation

(¬G → A13).natural: When the company fails to contain the security breach, breach detection triggers incident response

(¬G → A9).natural: Provided that the company does not contain the security breach, the legal team notifies regulatory authorities

(¬G → ¬A11).natural: If the company does not contain the security breach, then the forensic team does not conduct a digital investigation

(¬G → ¬A9).natural: Should the company fail to contain the security breach, the legal team does not notify regulatory authorities

A12.natural: The SIEM system monitors network traffic

A4.natural: The incident response team activates containment protocols

G.natural: The company contains the security breach

¬A10.natural: The company does not settle a class action lawsuit

¬A6.natural: The hacker does not bypass security protocols
